results.title: Get well stories
results.brief_description: Introduces Dorothy Butler who passionately believes books should play a crucial role in children’s lives. Attempt to encourage children to read, by capitalising on their fascination with the television screen. Uses professional storytellers and well-known stories, giving fully annotated details for each book used.

results.title: Germination and growth of a plant
results.brief_description:
Use of time-lapse photography showing the growth of a lupin plant. Shows the root growth below the ground, how the flower is pollinated by the bees and the internal germination is carried out - the production of the seed pod and finally the dispersal of the seeds.
Title and credits missing from film.

results.title: Germany of romance
results.brief_description: Accompanied by traditional music and the music of Wagner, Schumann, Brahms and Bach, the prospective tourist is shown the great man made and natural attractions of Germany and given glimpses of old and modern German life.

results.title: Georgie to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Richard Slapczynski, Israel M. Berman and Viking Films Miniature Film Studios
results.brief_description: An animated film about Mr and Mrs Whittaker who live in the country with their pet cat and their friends Miss Oliver the owl and Georgie the gentle ghost. Based on the book by Robert Bright.

results.title: George Melies cinema magician
results.creator_credit: Luciano Martinengo, Patrick Montgomery and Blackhawk Films
results.brief_description: Cinema’s first genius, Georges Melies, was a professional magician who quickly realised that the camera offered the best illusion machine in the world. Renowned for his trick films, he was actually the first to tell complete stories on film and the first to use the camera effects considered standard today

results.title: Generation on the wind
results.creator_credit: David A. Vassar, Joel Silverman, Samanther Shadd and Windmill Movie Company
results.brief_description: Details the year long construction of a wind generator on the small island of Cutty Hunk off the New England coast by a group of men who apply collective skills to a task new to all of them.

results.title: Geelong
results.creator_credit: John Porter and Eric Porter Productions
results.brief_description: On the shores of Corio Bay, 45 miles from Melbourne, the great factories of Geelong beat out a productive rhythm. People flock to the beach resorts of Torquay, Anglesea and Lorne; from Australian Rules to the Great Ocean Road, this film acts as a brochure to Victoria’s second largest city.

results.title: Gathering of the clans
results.brief_description: Scenes at the Gathering of the Clans held at Inverness in 1966. Traditional dancing, sports and the pipe band contest are shown. The history of Scottish culture as represented at the Gathering is briefly discussed.

results.title: Gateway to independence
results.brief_description: A guide dog gives independence to a blind person. Shows the careful selection and training of dogs and the training of the people who will use these dogs as aids to daily living. It stresses that complete confidence in the dog by its owner is essential for the success of the enterprise. Cinematography by Tom Cowan.
